channel.title: A real pirate game
channel.description:
So i was tryin out this pirate of the caribbean online disney shit, and i have to say it sucks. BUT the sea fighting is amazing. I love it.
So what i was wondering, why doesn't a company make a REAL pirate game? None of this disney shit. Im talking hardcore abusive bloody pirates that have no mercy, like gathering all the awesome graphiced games like cod, gta, fallout, etc and making some real shit? Making it like a mmorpg for pc and other systems, or at least co-op.
Imagin fallout or oblivion, but you're a pirate. When you think of the word pirate it sounds like kid friendly shit. No. I want something real.
And being on the sea the whole time wouldn't bug me at all. You could have a party (crew) and all board one ship, sailor and cannon operators and people who spot ships so they appear on the map. Don't you know how flying games are? The jets look fkn sweet but the ground is shit? They can do that with this. Distant land, water, and ships. First person would be nice to :P. And stuff like if you're kicked from the crew list you have to walk the plank then you go back to the main menu or something. When you die your body stays on board in a puddle of blood
Are there any games like this?

item.title: A real pirate game
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

That would be pretty mean, Grand Theft Ship. You start off as a deckhand pirate who has to do jobs for the captian like swab the deck and infiltrate enemy ships and kill the captains. Once you have another ship you are on your way to being the meanest most feared pirate on the seas, making your way from a nooby area where all the other players suck dick to the real dangerous seas where the ships can be fucked up and sunk by storms and the other players who have all the good as iron reinforced hulls in their ships and shit. And like if your ship sinks, you can swim but you have to avoid other players’ cannons and bad fish. If you find an island you can build yourself a dingy or cannoe or w/e or if you have enough time, a big ass ship. Like using a saw and cutting all the planks then nailing them onto the hull with wooden stakes and shit then using a sand/ash based resin to clog holes and make it sea worthy. That would be the best kind of game, one where the player can actually use the arms and hands to make anything out of anything.

Read full topic

[/quote]
I want a realistic one that pushes it to the limit and redefines piracy.[/quote]Very few ppl like realistic mmo’s cus they are casusalfags who are only in it for the grind

[quote=“cooper, post:14, topic:306672”][quote author=Frell link=topic=402842.msg2985457#msg2985457 date=1254946951]

I’d love this, but I don’t think most mainstream gamers would enjoy it very much unless it’s not very realistic.

I want a realistic one that pushes it to the limit and redefines piracy.

item.title: A real pirate game
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

There already are some pirate-mmos, problem is they are all the dumbed down linear theme-park type of games, hence there’s no room for non-combat activities like economy, crafting and trading.

item.title: A real pirate game
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

The closest game I can think of would be sid meier’s pirates but it’s still pretty disneyish.

The monkey island games are awesome pirate games, but they are adventure not rpg. 2 and 3 are probably the best, though different so you might like 1 and not the other.

Read full topic

item.title: A real pirate game
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

No, but there is definite demand for these games, so I don’t see why one shouldn’t be developed.

But I think you should really have ports, not just you die you go to main menu, this would allow trade, missions, odd-jobs.

GTA:Pirates anyone?

Read full topic
